sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• screen patients prior to administration for acute kidney injury, severe kidney disease (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)), and other conditions that may reduce renal function, and do not administer gadobutrol if kidney disease is identified; avoid use in patients with suspected or known impaired drug elimination unless alternative imaging modalities, including noncontrast MRI, are unable to provide essential diagnostic information; do not exceed the recommended dose and allow a sufficient period of time for elimination of the drug prior to readministration
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, CNS imaging: 0.1 mmol/kg (0.1 mL/kg) IV bolus
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, Of breast, to determine presence and extent of malignancy: 0.1 mmol/kg (0.1 mL/kg) IV bolus

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono:
• screen patients prior to administration for acute kidney injury, severe kidney disease (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)), and other conditions that may reduce renal function, and do not administer gadobutrol if kidney disease is identified; avoid use in patients with suspected or known impaired drug elimination unless alternative imaging modalities, including noncontrast MRI, are unable to provide essential diagnostic information; do not exceed the recommended dose and allow a sufficient period of time for elimination of the drug prior to readministration
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, CNS imaging: (term neonates or older) 0.1 mmol/kg (0.1 mL/kg) IV bolus

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment: avoid use in patients with acute kidney injury or chronic, severe kidney disease (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)) unless information is essential and unobtainable with other means
  • renal impairment: no dosage adjustment required
  • geriatric: no dosage adjustment required

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, CNS imaging
  • Magnetic resonance imaging, Of breast, to determine presence and extent of malignancy

2.title: Black Box Warning
2.mono:
Intravenous (Solution)
Gadolinium-based contrast agents (GBCAs) increase the risk for nephrogenic systemic fibrosis (NSF) in patients with impaired elimination of the drugs. Avoid use of GBCAs in these patients unless the diagnostic information is essential and not available with non-contrasted MRI or other modalities. The risk for NSF is greatest in patients with acute kidney injury or chronic, severe kidney disease (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2). Evaluate patients for acute kidney injury or other conditions which may reduce renal function. Patients at risk for chronically reduced renal function (eg, age greater than 60 years, hypertension, or diabetes) should have their estimate the glomerular filtration rate (GFR) determined through laboratory testing. Do not exceed the recommended gadobutrol dose in patients at highest risk for NSF. Allow sufficient time for the drug to be eliminated by the body prior to subsequent doses.

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity reactions, severe, to gadobutrol, history of

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Black Box Warning:
  • -- nephrogenic systemic fibrosis (NSF), which may result in fatal or debilitating fibrosis with skin, muscle, and internal organ involvement, has been reported; monitoring recommended
  • -- increased risk of NSF with repeated or higher than recommended doses, or in patients with acute renal injury, chronic severe renal impairment (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)), or at risk of chronically reduced renal impairment (eg, older than 60 years, diabetes, hypertension); monitoring recommended
  • -- avoid use in patients with impaired elimination of gadolinium-based contrast agents due to the increased risk of NSF
  • Dermatologic:
  • -- ensure catheter and venous patency as extravasation into tissues may result in moderate irritation
  • -- avoid IM administration
  • Immunologic:
  • -- anaphylactoid and anaphylactic reactions, which may be mild to severe or fatal, have occurred; monitoring recommended
  • Renal:
  • -- acute kidney injury, which may require dialysis, has been reported in patients with chronic renal impairment
  • -- increased risk of acute kidney injury with higher than recommended doses
  • Concomitant use:
  • -- do not mix with other drugs or agents

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Feels hot (0.5%), Injection site reaction (0.6%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Nausea (1.2%), Taste sense altered (0.5%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (1.5%)
Serious
  • Cardiovascular:Cardiac arrest
  • Immunologic:Anaphylactoid reaction, Anaphylaxis
  • Neurologic:Loss of consciousness (less than 0.1%)
  • Renal:Injury of kidney, Acute, Nephrogenic systemic fibrosis

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: In the presence of the MRI magnetic field, gadobutrol shortens the longitudinal (spin-lattice) relaxation times (T1) and the transverse (spin-spin) relaxation times (T2) and may improve visualization of disruptions of the blood brain barrier or abnormalities of vascularity of the CNS.

3.title: Excretion
3.mono:
• Renal: 50% unchanged within 2 hours; 90% unchanged within 12 hours; pediatrics, 99% within 6 hours; mild or moderate renal impairment, complete recovery within 72 hours; severe renal impairment, 80% within 5 days
  • Renal clearance: healthy subjects, 1.1 to 1.7 mL/min/kg
  • Dialyzable: Yes (hemodialysis), 68%, 94% after the second dialysis, and 98% after the third dialysis
  • Total body clearance: Adults, 0.094 L/hr/kg; pediatrics, 0.081 to 0.128 L/hr/kg; elderly, decreased

4.title: Elimination Half Life
4.mono:
• Adults, 1.8 hours
  • Pediatrics, 1.66 to 2.91 hours
  • Renal impairment (mild to moderate), 5.8 hours
  • Renal impairment (severe not on dialysis), 17.6 hours

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    avoid IM administration
  • Intravenous
    • Bulk packages are not for use in direct IV infusions.
    • Gadobutrol concentration (1 mmol/mL) may be higher than other gadolinium-based contrast media agents; carefully determine correct volume to administer.
    • Administer by IV bolus injection at flow rate of approximately 2 mL/sec, manually or with power injector.
    • Flush IV cannula with NS after injection.
    • Use immediately after solution is drawn into syringe; discard any unused portions.
    • Discard used IV tubing and syringes.
    • Do not mix with other drugs.
    • Use bulk packages within 24 hours of initial puncture.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• enhanced visualization of lesions during MRI examination may be indicative of efficacy
  • hypersensitivity reactions or anaphylaxis; during and following drug administration

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause dysgeusia, feeling hot, headaches, nausea, or injection site reactions (eg, burning, pain, and hot or cold sensations).
  • Instruct patient to report signs/symptoms of nephrogenic systemic fibrosis (burning, itching, swelling, scaling, hardening and tightening of the skin; red or dark patches on the skin; muscle weakness; pain in hips or ribs; and joint stiffness).
